author: Mitch Anderson
description:
Political spin and hard facts had another messy moment in Alberta this month. The governing United Conservative Party just released a report touting their alleged strong record on cutting greenhouse gas emissions. “The 2023 report shows our oil sands sector is producing more energy with fewer emissions per barrel — a clear sign of innovation […]

The post Alberta’s ‘Emissions Intensity’ Hasn’t Improved, Despite Government Claim appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Alberta’s ‘Emissions Intensity’ Hasn’t Improved, Despite Government Claim

author: Sharon Kelly
description:
As Woodside Energy investors convened for their annual meeting in Perth, Australia, on May 8, they were met by protests and heckling. Activists, angered over the fossil fuel company’s climate impacts and accidents, repeatedly disrupted speeches by company management. While management and demonstrators debated, Woodside workers about 800 miles to the north were scrambling to […]

The post Safety Warnings Follow Australia’s Woodside Energy to U.S. as $17 Billion LNG Project Moves Ahead appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Safety Warnings Follow Australia’s Woodside Energy to U.S. as $17 Billion LNG Project Moves Ahead

author: Adam Barnett and Sam Bright
description:
Reform UK leader Nigel Farage is set to speak at an event today organised by a pro-Trump think tank and held in the home of the UK’s main climate science denial group, DeSmog can reveal. Farage, whose party campaigns to scrap the UK’s goal of achieving net zero emissions, is the star speaker at the […]

The post Nigel Farage to Headline Tufton Street Climate Denial Event appeared first on DeSmog.
title: Nigel Farage to Headline Tufton Street Climate Denial Event
